tools.name: Cube
tools.selector: #headerToolbarMenu > div > div:nth-child(1) > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > a
tools.function: Create 3D Cube object

tools.name: Sphere
tools.function: Create 3D Sphere object

tools.name: Cylinder
tools.function: Create 3D Cylinder object

tools.name: Icosahedron
tools.function: Create 3D Icosahedron object

tools.name: Plane
tools.function: Create 2D Plane

tools.name: L-shape
tools.function: Create 3D L-shape object

tools.name: Torus
tools.function: Create 3D Torus object

tools.name: Cone
tools.function: Create 3D Cone object

tools.name: Torus-knot
tools.function: Create 3D Torus-knot object

tools.name: Octahedron
tools.function: Create 3D Octahedron object

tools.name: Capsule
tools.function: Create 3D Capsule object

tools.name: Star
tools.function: Create 3D Star object

tools.name: Shape Generator
tools.function: Dropdown that allows user to generate either Screw & Nut, a spiral, a gear or text.

tools.name: Screw & Nut generator
tools.function: Allows user to insert screw and nut objects

tools.name: Spiral generator
tools.function: Allows user to insert spiral object

tools.name: Gear generator
tools.function: Allows user to insert gear object

tools.name: Text generator
tools.function: Allows user to insert text object

tools.name: Drawing
tools.function: Dropdown from which user can choose to start a freehand drawing or 3D Sketch

tools.name: Freehand
tools.selector: #headerToolbarMenu > div > div:nth-child(3) > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > a
tools.function: Start freehand drawing. Allows you to freely draw and customize the 3D model

tools.name: 3D Sketch
tools.function: Start 3D Sketch. It serves as a tool that builds a frame that you can later fill up with the help of other tools.

tools.name: Move
tools.function: Allows user to move existing objects

tools.name: Rotate
tools.function: Allows user to rotate existing objects

tools.name: Scale
tools.function: Allows user to shrink or enlarge object

tools.name: Deform
tools.function: Dropdown offering object deforming options: skew, taper, twist, bend, inflate and flatten.

tools.name: Skew
tools.selector: #headerToolbarMenu > div > div:nth-child(7) > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > a
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by skewing it

tools.name: Taper
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by tapering it

tools.name: Twist
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by twisting it

tools.name: Bend
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by bending it. You’ll find here another Advanced Option called Dynamic Origin - it basically forces the model to wraps itself in an attempt to create a perfect circle.

tools.name: Inflate
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by inflating it

tools.name: Flatten
tools.function: Allows user to deform object by flattening it

tools.name: Extrusion
tools.function: Allows user to Extrude face or sketch

tools.name: Inset
tools.function: The Inset tool splits polygons (or faces, if they are selected) and smaller versions of it.

tools.name: Add Thickness
tools.function: Add Thickness allows you to add volume to your models, and its basic usage is to add thickness to open figures (such as containers)

tools.name: Chamfer
tools.function: Allows user to Chamfer edges of object

tools.name: Fillet
tools.function: Allows user to Fillet edges of object

tools.name: Round Object
tools.function: Round Object is somewhat similar to Chamfer, but it’s not restricted to rounding just the edges of a figure, but the figure as a whole. By increasing the level of Smoothness your figure will become more and more rounded. The advanced option called Linear allows you to simply smooth the surface by adding detail to the figure without changing its shape.

tools.name: Simplify Object
tools.function: Simplify object works by directly deleting polygons from the figure. For example when using this tool on a simple sphere, it turns into something cruder.

tools.name: Resolution
tools.function: Allows you to change the resolution of a selected 3D Model (or its Polygon). There is only one slider to this tool, and by moving it, you’ll either increase or decrease the number of segments that the figure consists of. Models with more segments can be modeled in a more precise manner - this tool is perfect for adding and removing the complexity, and in contrast to the Simplify Object tool, the Resolution does not change the geometry of the model.

tools.name: Edit Details
tools.function: Allows you to manually increase the level of detail of the figure, by splitting existing faces into smaller ones. You can do it either by clicking on the figure to add Vertices or by dragging an existing edge to its neighboring face to create a new edge there.

tools.name: Cut With Plane
tools.function: Cut object with intersection of Plane

tools.name: Cut with Profile
tools.function: Allows you to engrave unique shapes on your figure. To use this successfully, you need to draw a 3D Sketch first, and then use the tool to engrave said sketch onto the model.

tools.name: Modify
tools.function: Dropdown with object modification options: Extrusion, Inset, Add Thickness, Chamfer, Fillet, Round Object, Simplify Object, Resolution, Edit Details, Cut With Plane and Cut with Profile.

tools.name: Stitch & Scoop
tools.function: Stitch & Scoop is a boolean tool that allows the union, difference, inclusion or intersection of multiple objects to be extracted

tools.name: Copy Offsets
tools.function: Creates a copy of an object with the possibility of setting up a precise distance between the copy and the original. There is an option to set the number of copies that the software will create, in which case the copies will be distributed evenly between the original, and the copy with an offset.

tools.name: Fill Polygons
tools.function: The Fill Polygons tool fills up profiles, and patches up all the hollow spaces in polygons.

tools.name: Revolve
tools.function: The revolve tool uses a shape or a profile as a base and revolves it, creating a solid 3D model.

tools.name: Bridge
tools.function: The Bridge tool creates a connection between two sets of edges or faces by 'bridging' them.

tools.name: Loft
tools.function: The Loft tool creates a smooth, often complex surface by blending between two or more cross-sectional profiles (curves or sketches).

tools.name: Follow Path
tools.function: Follow path turns existing sketches (an outline and a path) into 3D models

tools.name: Magic Fix
tools.function: Allows you to rebuild your objects by replacing all flat surfaces with cubes. By manipulating the Block Density you’re able to choose into how many cubes each Face will be split into - the bigger the density, the smaller the individual blocks and more detailed the overall shape.

tools.name: Magic Path
tools.function: A tool that rebuilds your objects by removing small, unprintable details. It’s a good practice to use this tool before printing

tools.name: Tools
tools.function: A dropdown which allows user to choose different tools: magic path, magic fix, follow path, revolve, loft, bridge, fill polygons and copy offsets.

tools.name: Utilities
tools.function: A dropdown which allows the user to choose from different utility options: align, snap, measurements, dimensions, mirror, combine, split, geom clean and flip normals.

tools.name: Sculpting
tools.function: Sculpting is a tool you can use to add the most minute details and finishing touches to your designs. Sculpting works in a completely different way from other tools - here you don’t manipulate the object directly by changing the settings of the tool, but by using different brushes directly onto the object itself to invoke a change.

tools.name: Image to 3D
tools.function: The Image to 3D tool allows you to convert any picture into a 3D model.

tools.name: 3D print
tools.function: The option to 3D Print your design. This tool will slice the object, and generate a GCode in preparation for 3D printing.

tools.name: Animation
tools.function: The Animation tool allows you to record everything you do in the software. Each action becomes a separate slider on the timeline, so you can later overlap and stack them together, to make it look like multiple changes were added to a model at the same time. When all is set, you can download the animation in the GIF format.

tools.name: Render
tools.function: The Render dropdown gives access to other render tools such as Render Image and Texture Baking.

tools.name: Render Image
tools.function: The render image tool allows the object to be rendered as an image

tools.name: Texture Baking
tools.function: The texture baking tool allows you to create a texture that can then be used in rendering

tools.name: Projections
tools.function: The Projections tool is used to transfer or project geometry (such as points, lines, edges, or faces) from one part of the model to another, often onto a different plane, surface, or sketch.

tools.name: Tutorials
tools.function: The tutorials dropdown gives the user access to the following tools: record tutorial, play tutorial, my library and interactive tutorials.

tools.name: Record Tutorial
tools.selector: #headerToolbarMenu > div > div:nth-child(18) > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > a
tools.function: The record tutorial tool allows the user to record a tutorial of themselves making an object

tools.name: Play Tutorial
tools.function: The play tutorial tool allows the user to play one of their tutorials they have filmed

tools.name: My Library
tools.function: The My Library tool opens up a separate tab where the user can view previously made tutorials

tools.name: Interactive Tutorials
tools.function: The Interactive Tutorials tool opens up a separate tab and allows the user to watch other interactive tutorials made by other members of the community

tools.name: Align
tools.function: The Align tool can be used to align one object to another. There are options to choose to what exactly do you want to align your figure - you can align 3D models to other figures in the grid, or the grid itself, select which part of the figure should be aligned and even set precise offset (distance) between the aligned objects.

tools.name: Snap
tools.function: The Snap tool allows you to immediately move selected shape to any place on the grid or onto any model. There is also an option to set the offset between the model and the point you want to snap it to.

tools.name: Measurements
tools.function: Measurements serve as a simple measuring tool - you can use it to measure lengths, distances, and angles.You can also use it to resize them, by selecting a specific length or an angle and changing its value in the bottom-left part of the screen.

tools.name: Dimensions
tools.function: The tool Dimensions can be used to add physical measurements to the grid. You can create them based on length, angle, and even create arcs. What stands out about this tool, is the fact that you can use the generated guides as points of reference to which you can snap objects to.

tools.name: Mirror
tools.function: The Mirror tool creates a mirrored copy of a figure.

tools.name: Combine
tools.function: The Merge Objects tool allows you to connect objects without changing their geometry. It works correctly when the shapes you want to merge do not overlap each other.

tools.name: Split
tools.function: The Split option allows you to split selected parts of the model and create a separate shape out of them. You won’t see the change in the mesh itself, but then you look at the scene panel you’ll see that the split part became a separate object, which you can now model independently.

tools.name: Geom Clean
tools.function: This tool helps clean the geometry of a shape by removing certain vertices

tools.name: Flip Normals
tools.function: The Flip tool allows you to turn a selected face or polygon inside-out.
